block.p: Naomi Metzger, a daughter of Beth and Mark Metzger of Englewood, N.J., was married last evening to Joseph Carl Daniels, a son of Susan and Lawrence Stephen Daniels of Cambridge, Mass. Rabbi Cy Stanway officiated at the summer home of the bride's parents in Elberon, N.J.

Mrs. Daniels, 27, teaches social studies at the Beacon School, an alternative high school in New York. She graduated from Lehigh University and received a master's degree in teaching social studies from Columbia. Her father is a managing partner in BEM Management, an investment company in New York. The bride's grandfather the late Matthew Feldman was a member of the New Jersey State Senate from 1974 to 1994 and its president in 1976 and 1977.

Mrs. Daniels, 27, teaches social studies at the Beacon School, an alternative high school in New York. She graduated from Lehigh University and received a master's degree in teaching social studies from Columbia. Her father is a managing partner in BEM Management, an investment company in New York. The bride's grandfather the late Matthew Feldman was a member of the New Jersey State Senate from 1974 to 1994 and its president in 1976 and 1977.

Mr. Daniels, 28, was until February an associate at the New York law firm Cravath, Swaine & Moore. In September he is to become a consultant at McKinsey & Company in New York. He graduated from Washington University in St. Louis and received a law degree cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. His father retired as the vice president for strategic planning at Biogen, a biotechnology company in Cambridge. The bridegroom's mother is a volunteer teacher's aide at the Agassiz School in Cambridge.
